posts.post_content:
The fact that even with cards like this, [Sharuum the Hegemon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sharuum the Hegemon), and [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter), Esper took a back seat to Jund and Bant at tournaments really speaks volumes.  
  
  
@InternetNinjacy  
*"I love stumbling into artifact cards and seeing "Works great with [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter). There are probably three whole artifacts in the history of magic that DON'T work with [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter). Stop bringing it up, we get it."*  
  
I'm pretty sure people are bringing that up because of the "during your upkeep" clause on [Scourglass](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scourglass). So along with only paying U, you get to put it down on the safety of your upkeep and activate it immediately. If that doesn't sound like a huge deal, consider that in a 1-on-1 if you tutored this (rather than top-decking it) you're shaving one turn off of locking down the game, and in a larger game… well, put this down on your main phase and see if you can survive to your ne... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

If that doesn't sound like a huge deal, consider that in a 1-on-1 if you tutored this (rather than top-decking it) you're shaving one turn off of locking down the game, and in a larger game… well, put this down on your main phase and see if you can survive to your ne... posts.post_content: Really didn't want the card in my artifact deck but my wife made me put it in(obviously she is smarter than me). Playing a friend of mine put it in play. He had Broodmother dragon(?) on the board for a while. MANY DRAGON TOKENS. 1 Scourglass later, cleared the board of ALL his dragons and won the game. He officially hates the deck now and named it "Outta Time".

It's a whole new board, your opponent won't have any permanents.
